column4: Hello, my hard drives have disappeared and when I attempt to open "computer" it says nautilus can't handle computer:locations
Help?
Can someone help me?
hang on, let me see
not listed on ls /media
it could always find it until now
Yes.
Are you having trouble with an NTFS autmount?
Did you exit Windows cleanly the last time?
and it's not listed in fdisk?
Maybe fstab got corrupted. gksudo gedit /etc/fstab
did it
Please pastebin the content of the file.
Pastebin. paste.ubuntu.com
As I thought, there is no entry in your fstab for your ntfs partition.
Do you still have it open?
You may PM me if you wish.
If you want to be absolutely sure you're targeting the right drive, run sudo fdisk -l to figure out which drive is which before running the installer.
I'm installing Ubuntu Studio. No Live CD. Just text-based
Well, I would still run fdisk, and use that information to make sure the installer targets the right drive.

Oh, that's right, the UbuntuStudio disk probably doesn't have all the same packages installed. Well, if they are two physically separate drives, they will probably be named something like sda1 (for the first drive) and sdb1 (for the second). Usually, it will show their sizes and so forth, so hopefully you'll be able to tell them apart.
